ACT
89.  
Definition of reciprocal will of spouses
A reciprocal will of spouses is a will made jointly by the spouses in which they reciprocally nominate one another as his or her successor or make other dispositions of the estate in the event of his or her death.
In a reciprocal will of spouses the validity of a disposition made by one spouse depends on the validity of a disposition made by the other spouse if it may be presumed that the disposition of one spouse would not have been made without the disposition of the other spouse. If spouses have made dispositions reciprocally for the benefit of one another or designated to whom the estate of the surviving spouse or other proceeds received on the basis of the reciprocal will transfer, it is presumed that the disposition would not have been made without the disposition of the other spouse.
A reciprocal will of spouses shall be made in a notarially authenticated form.
